title: [Cancer] Study reveals potential of dimeric IgA (dIgA) to target cancer proteins. dIgA was shown to neutralize specific mutated cytoplasmic oncogenes (KRASG12D) inside ovarian carcinoma cells, providing a rationale to develop dIgA-based therapeutics for human cancers and other diseases.
[Health] Audio-visual integration is more precise in older adults with a high level of long-term physical activity
